channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti on Flyover, 13th July
item.description:
Graffiti on the flyover A13 at Canning Town Roundabout junction, Been there for 2+ years now.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of rubbish on ground, bins overflowing, 13th July
item.description:
Every weekend, the bins in Belair Park are overflowing. This happens consistently following Friday and Saturday night, in particular in and around the playground and tennis courts. Has been happening particularly badly since the days got longer and warmer, but is an ongoing issue over multiple years.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thurlow Park Road, Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Racist and obscene graffiti, 13th July
item.description:
Near the cobbled area next to the underpass in Burgess Park, racist and obscene graffiti has been spray painted onto a wall, per the attached picture

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Wells Way, Walworth, London

item.title: Fly tipping on the pavement, 13th July
item.description:
There is a mattress and chest of drawers been left on the pavement on the corner of Dalmeny Road and Rydal Drive and a bag a little further along with gas cannisters by the green phone connection box.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Dalmeny Road, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Park tree used as domestic dump, 13th July
item.description:
Someone has used this part of Brunswick park near Brunswick Road to dump household items within the boundary used to protect a tree and even used the same tree to hang a picture. This is an inappropriate use of a public recreational space.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maynard Close, West Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over flowing bin, 13th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garland Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Front garden rubbish tip, 13th July
item.description:

item.title: Furniture and glass dumped, 13th July
item.description:
More than a week since this was dumped next to the ‘24 hour surveillance’ sign. Glasss shards on the pavement and furniture and cardboard blocking the path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roydene Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Concern about Public Safety and Cleanliness – Unauthorised Tent Encampment, 13th July
item.description:
Dear Greenwich Council, I am writing to report an unauthorised tent encampment that has developed in a public area near my residence. The site is located at the golf range - river front close to the O2, and has been present for several weeks The encampment is affecting the public environment and safety of the neighbourhood. It has led to increased littering, obstruction of pedestrian pathways, and a general decline in the area’s cleanliness and sense of security. I kindly request that the council investigate this matter and take appropriate action to restore the area and ensure public safety. Thank you for your attention. Kind regards,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ordnance Crescent, Greenwich Peninsula, London
Report on FixMyStreet
